channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Launches New Ground Incursion in Lebanon, Raising Fears for Truce
item.description: Israel has been conducting near-daily strikes against what it says are Hezbollah targets as the Iranian-backed group comes under pressure to disarm am...

item.title: Nvidia makes history as first $4 trillion company, Jensen Huang’s net worth surges $25 billion year-to-date
item.description: Jensen Huang is cracking the world's top 10 richest list as his AI chips manufacturer makes history.

item.title: Business and real estate titans are plowing millions into Mayor Eric Adams’ re-election campaign
item.description: The surprise success of Zohran Mamdani’s campaign has some business leaders backing his opponent.

item.title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino Says She Is Leaving Elon Musk’s Platform
item.description: Linda Yaccarino, whom Elon Musk hired to run X in 2023, grappled with the challenges the company faced after Mr. Musk took over.

item.title: Elon Musk’s feud with Trump and ‘America Party’ gambit hit Tesla shares and wiped up to $15 billion off his net worth
item.description: Tesla stock dropped nearly 7% on Monday, erasing about $68 billion in market value for shareholders.

item.title: Death Toll Reaches at Least 119 in Texas Floods, With 173 Missing
item.description: Officials defended their actions in the hardest-hit county, where no survivors have been found since Friday and questions are mounting over disaster p...

item.title: Meet Apple’s next COO Sahib Khan, a 30-year veteran who will oversee the iPhone maker’s supply chain amid the ‘Trump tariff black cloud’
item.description: CEO Tim Cook appears confident in Sahib Khan’s ability to weather the enumerable challenges impacting Apple.

item.title: U.K.’s richest prime minister ever just bagged a Goldman Sachs gig—he’s also made $668K in 3 months from appearances, and still works in government
item.description: Despite having millions to his name, Rishi Sunak is not throwing in the towel on working—he’s taken up multiple side gigs like speaking engagements an...

item.title: As the Texas Floodwaters Rose, One Indispensable Voice Was Silent
item.description: The National Weather Service put out good forecasts. But a vital employee was missing.

item.title: New Research Questions Severity of Withdrawal From Antidepressants
item.description: Warnings about withdrawal from antidepressants have rippled through society in recent years. A new study claims they are overblown.

item.title: Recipients of a U.S. Climate Science Fellowship Are Put on Unpaid Leave
item.description: Researchers in the NOAA program were furloughed because funds to pay them were not available.

item.title: Trump to Discuss Economic Investment With African Leaders at White House Meeting
item.description: The administration is aiming to strike deals to expand the United States’ access to critical minerals and to counter China’s rising influence in Afric...

item.title: French Police Raid National Rally Over Campaign Finances
item.description: The authorities said they were investigating whether the nationalist, anti-immigrant party broke France’s campaign-finance rules.

item.title: Israel Launches New Ground Incursion in Lebanon, Raising Fears for Truce
item.description: Israel has been conducting near-daily strikes against what it says are Hezbollah targets as the Iranian-backed group comes under pressure to disarm am...

item.title: A Dark-of-Night Flood Escape at the River Inn in Texas
item.description: Along the Guadalupe River, a 60-room inn and nearby homes were quickly filling with water. Confusion, desperation and heroism ensued.
